channel.title: 3mpwr App - Curated Disability News
channel.description: Daily curated news on disability rights, accessibility, and benefits across Canada

item.title: Manitoba Government Passes Legislation to Respond to Meth Crisis
item.dc:creator: 3mpwr App Curator

item.title: Will Canada actually join Eurovision? Not without some challenges, experts say
item.description: Yesterday's budget teased that the government is working with CBC/Radio-Canada to explore Canada's participation in the Eurovision Song Contest. While Europop fans might be excited, Canadian participation might not be all that easy, as past attempts have proved.
item.dc:creator: 3mpwr App Curator

item.title: Budget's impact on Canadian economy will depend on ‘execution': Macklem
item.description: The Bank of Canada governor told MPs he believes the budget got the diagnosis right on what ails the Canadian economy: flagging productivity and low investment levels.
item.dc:creator: 3mpwr App Curator

item.title: The Supreme Court of Canada Wants You to Call 911 if Someone Is Overdosing
item.description: Police can’t arrest a person for drug possession if they call for help and stick around, a new ruling finds.
item.dc:creator: 3mpwr App Curator

item.title: ‘We’re in an Emergency. We Have Got to Start Talking’
item.description: Environmentalist and documentarian Avi Lewis is taking another swing at federal politics. This time, he wants to lead the NDP. A Tyee Q&A.
item.dc:creator: 3mpwr App Curator

item.title: Indigenous leaders decry budget’s lack of money for key reconciliation programs
item.description: Indigenous leaders are concerned after this year’s federal budget left key reconciliation programs without guaranteed money beyond spring 2026. Programs covering education, health and urban Indigenous friendship centres are running out of money, prompting fears they could be terminated or face massive cuts.
item.dc:creator: 3mpwr App Curator

item.title: Alberta unions promise ‘big and bold’ response — but can they deliver?
item.description: On the heels of the Alberta government’s decision to use the Charter's notwithstanding clause to force striking teachers back to work, the provincial labour movement is flirting with a tactic that its leaders say would be “big and bold and unprecedented" — but they’re still not quite ready to flip the switch.
item.dc:creator: 3mpwr App Curator

item.title: Expelled CAQ member of Quebec legislature slams government over doctor payment bill
item.description: Isabelle Poulet says she is 'profoundly disappointed' by how the CAQ government has handled a new law that changes how doctors in Quebec are paid.
item.dc:creator: 3mpwr App Curator

item.title: Will Alberta Kill Recall Laws Now That UCP MLAs Are at Risk?
item.description: Legislation stripping teachers of their Charter rights has brought new challenges to the Smith government.
item.dc:creator: 3mpwr App Curator

item.title: Carney's budget needs 2 more votes. Here's the local funding that could get it passed
item.description: With one MP already crossing the floor to join the Liberals, Prime Minister Mark Carney now needs only two more votes, or abstentions, to pass his budget. And there is some local funding that opposition MPs might find hard to resist.
item.dc:creator: 3mpwr App Curator

item.title: Moose set loose in B.C. Interior with the help of a Canadian flag
item.description: On a sleepy fall morning in the quiet woods of B.C. Interior, a young moose trapped inside a paddock was led to freedom by an animal lover and a Canadian flag.
item.dc:creator: 3mpwr App Curator

item.title: Manitoba Government Accepts All Recommendations From Independent Review of The Planning Amendment Act and The City of Winnipeg Charter Amendment Act (Bill 37)
item.dc:creator: 3mpwr App Curator

item.title: Manitoba Government Adds 800 Teachers in Two Years
item.dc:creator: 3mpwr App Curator

item.title: Saskatchewan industries welcome federal budget with unanswered questions
item.description: Key industries in Saskatchewan say they are welcoming the federal government's new budget, but still have questions on its implementation and have issues to be addressed.
item.dc:creator: 3mpwr App Curator

item.title: Ottawa to restore privacy provision mistakingly struck from streaming law
item.description: The federal budget says the government will make a legislative amendment to the Online Streaming Act that will "restore the right to privacy of individuals."
item.dc:creator: 3mpwr App Curator

item.title: On Our Radar: Scarlet Fever’s debut LP, Girl with Shank, cuts deep
item.description: The four-piece Vancouver band has been a regular at shows around town lately.
item.dc:creator: 3mpwr App Curator

item.title: There's still time to win a Canadian getaway—and support B.C.’s hospitality workers
item.description: Two days left to support BC hospitality workers.
item.dc:creator: 3mpwr App Curator

item.title: Pressure grows on Quebec to force an end to Montreal transit strikes
item.description: A coalition of business groups is calling on the Quebec government to take action to end the ongoing transit strikes. The workers are accusing the business leaders of only looking out for their profits at the expense of workers’ rights.
item.dc:creator: 3mpwr App Curator

item.title: Kelowna, B.C., is the 1st Canadian city recognized by UNESCO for its food and cuisine
item.description: The picturesque lakeside city in Okanagan Valley has been designated a “Creative City of Gastronomy ” by the United Nations Educational, Scientific and Cultural Organization (UNESCO).
item.dc:creator: 3mpwr App Curator

item.title: 'Cloud' of tension between Aboriginal title and private property ownership lands in B.C.
item.description: Decades ago one of B.C.'s top judges described tensions between the legal concept of Aboriginal title and the reality of private property ownership as a "cloud." Last week, just as Southin predicted, the "cloud" touched down in Richmond.
item.dc:creator: 3mpwr App Curator

item.title: ‘Sign of confidence': Edmonton reacts to Budget 2025
item.description: The federal government is calling its spending plan 'generational investments,' and the Edmonton Chamber of Commerce says it is on the right track.
item.dc:creator: 3mpwr App Curator

item.title: Losing hope, he quit the Nunavik police. Years later, many still feel unsupported by the force
item.description: Johnny Saunders quit his job as a Nunavik police officer 20 years ago. He says the same issues that led to him leave remain unaddressed. Earlier this week, residents held marches across the region to denounce police brutality and an erosion of trust.
item.dc:creator: 3mpwr App Curator

item.title: 'Bring my dad home,' pleads son of Sask. man missing since June 2022
item.description: The family of Drew Ballantyne continues to look for information about what might have happened to him. Ballantyne was last seen in June 2022.
item.dc:creator: 3mpwr App Curator

item.title: Edmonton man faces troubles trying to get abandoned vehicle towed away
item.description: When Paul Johnson reported an abandoned vehicle to the city, he says he was told that he would have to wait almost a year because there is no room in the impound lots.
item.dc:creator: 3mpwr App Curator

item.title: Has Separatism Gone Mainstream in Alberta?
item.description: We spent the summer exploring the question. Here’s what we learned.
item.dc:creator: 3mpwr App Curator

item.title: Canadian history is dotted with floor-crossers. Votes haven't always been thrilled
item.dc:creator: 3mpwr App Curator

item.title: Sask. uranium company says White House won't meddle in its core business under U.S. reactor deal
item.description: The chief executive of Saskatchewan-based Cameco Corp. wants to make clear that the U.S. government is not getting involved in its main uranium mining business under a massive nuclear reactor deal announced last week.
item.dc:creator: 3mpwr App Curator

item.title: Penticton city council delays vote on homeless tiny home community, risks losing funding
item.description: Plans to transform a parcel of land into a tiny home community for the homeless in Penticton have been put on hold.
item.dc:creator: 3mpwr App Curator

item.title: Volunteers clean every veteran gravestone at Lethbridge cemetery by hand
item.description: Whether a retired veteran or a child just starting out in life, community members gathered to honour veterans eternally laid to rest at Lethbridge's Mountain View cemetery.
item.dc:creator: 3mpwr App Curator

item.title: Heart of the City Festival showcases the Downtown Eastside's commitment to building community
item.description: "These are real people, with real feelings.”
item.dc:creator: 3mpwr App Curator

item.title: Let’s see how the federal budget compares to Liberal promises
item.dc:creator: 3mpwr App Curator

item.title: Communities from across Saskatchewan gather to discuss preserving Indigenous language
item.description: Saskatchewan has many different Indigenous languages and dialects as it is an important part of culture. The Language Keepers Gathering opened up talks about preserving language.
item.dc:creator: 3mpwr App Curator

item.title: Mayor calls N.L. fish plant fire during hurricane-force winds 'a perfect storm'
item.description: St. Mary’s Mayor Steve Ryan describes Tuesday night’s events as “a perfect storm.” The town's fish plant had burned down in the middle of a storm that brought hurricane-force winds. Those weather conditions are expected to continue through Wednesday.
item.dc:creator: 3mpwr App Curator
